result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Minturn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs waived. DNA Surcharge and DV Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Remain in good standing with Drug Treatment Court.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

filed by the State

02:05 PM Defendant James D Minturn in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Plea and sentencing hearing.
State recites plea agreement.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 are dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Withheld sentence (Credit for 48 days if revoked)

Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
-	Remain in good standing with Drug Treatment Court

COSTS:  waived

DV Surcharge: $100.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Plea hearing on March 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.   CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:37 PM Defendant James D Minturn in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses motion to modify the no contact order with Victim A in 22CF202 as well as a motion to modify the amount of cash bail ordered in all cases.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by Victim A in 22CF202.  Objections by the State.  State advises the defendant is eligible for DTC on some of the cases.  For the reasons stated on the record the Court orders the conditions of bail modified from no contact with Victim A to no violent contact with Victim A.  Court orders the GPS reporting requirement removed from the conditions of bond.  For the reasons stated on the record the Court declines to modify the amount of cash bail.  Defense requests a date for a change of plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:01 AM Defendant James D Minturn in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Nimmer previously filed a motion to modify bail and scheduled a date with the Judge's Clerk.  The Court will schedule this matter for a bail hearing before the Trial Court.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Motion to Modify Bail
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Amanda Nimmer, requesting to modify conditions of bail.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
